issue.title: - Fix issue #866 and some other small bugs found during implementation.

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
- Fix bug in function plot_series in utils.plotting to plot for both DataFrame and Series. 
- Fix issue  #866, in _get_fre in utils.datetime to extract variant frequency of the series, e.g. 'w-sun'. 
- Fix bug in check_series in utils.validation.series to force all y to series if univariate. 
- Fix bug in _fbprophet and _statsmodels in forecasting.base.adpters to force a univariate data frame to series.

body:
Thanks, this is also related to #868 I believe. 

But have you tried using a `pd.PeriodIndex` as suggested in the error message? This works for me:
```python
from sktime.forecasting.exp_smoothing import ExponentialSmoothing
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

forecaster = ExponentialSmoothing()
date = pd.period_range(start='01/07/2018',end='05/09/2021',freq='W')
value = np.random.normal(size=175)
ts = pd.Series(value, index=date)
forecaster.fit(ts)
forecaster.predict(fh=np.arange(1,10))
```

issue.title: datetime: Construct Timedelta from parsed pandas frequency

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Add support for non-unit frequencies (eg: 30 minutes) by parsing the pandas frequency and extracting the relevant values to pass on to pd.Timedelta().

This works for frequencies like `D` and `3D`, as demonstrated by the test.

This does not work with [anchored offsets](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/user_guide/timeseries.html#anchored-offsets), like the `W-SUN` mentioned in #866, as it's not immediately obvious to me how one would construct a correct Timedelta from this. I suspect that the anchor can simply be dropped (7 days are 7 days, no matter whether they start on Sunday or Monday), but I'm not entirely sure, and I had a hard time constructing a test example.

Fixes: #868

issue.title: [BUG] pandas frequency W-WED in `ForecastingHorizon` causes failure in `AutoETS.predict`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--

--> I have a weekly dataset with W-WED frequency that I want to train an AutoETS model on. The predict step throws an error when it does not understand this datetime frequency.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# play example: 2 years of weekly data
train = pd.Series(np.random.uniform(low=2000, high=7000, size=(104,)), index=pd.date_range("2019-01-02", freq="W-WED", periods=104))

# setup AutoETS model
from sktime.forecasting.ets import AutoETS
forecaster = AutoETS(auto=True, sp=52, n_jobs=-1, restrict=True)
forecaster.fit(train)
pred = forecaster.predict(np.arange(1, 27)) # <---- this step throws the error
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--

--> I expect the model to be trained on the weekly data and to return predictions for the requested forecast horizon.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
--> If I set my datetime index to None, it will complain there is no freq supplied. But it does not understand the weekly index, so I am stuck.

**Versions**
<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

System:
    python: 3.7.11 (default, Jul 27 2021, 09:42:29) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]
executable: C:\Users\szipk\anaconda3\envs\py37\python.exe
   machine: Windows-10-10.0.19041-SP0

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.0.1
   setuptools: 49.6.0.post20200925
      sklearn: 0.24.2
       sktime: 0.7.0
  statsmodels: 0.12.2
        numpy: 1.19.2
        scipy: 1.6.2
       Cython: 0.29.24
       pandas: 1.3.2
   matplotlib: 3.4.2
       joblib: 1.0.1
        numba: 0.53.1
     pmdarima: 1.8.2
      tsfresh: 0.18.0

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->

issue.title: Fix bug frequency issue alan-turing-institute#866 with test file

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
- Fix issue ExponentialSmoothing results in error for a series with w-sun freq #866, in _get_fre in utils.datetime to extract the variant frequency of the series, e.g. 'w-sun'.
- Add associated test file.
